intro: Lycopersicon dentatum, commonly known as the wild tomato, is a flowering plant in the Solanaceae family. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has hairy stems and oval, toothed leaves. Its flowers are yellow with five petals, and it produces small, red, edible fruits similar to domestic tomatoes. It is often used in horticultural research due to its genetic relationship to cultivated tomatoes.
